revised_title: The Causes of Different Tastes of Waters and Edge of Razors
tldr: The author, Antony van Leeuwenhoek, investigates the causes of different tastes in water and the edge of razors. He discovers that boiling water helps remove volatile salts responsible for unpleasant tastes, and examines the notches and holes in razor edges, attributing them to metal corrosion and the hardness of the steel.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Metalworking and Manufacturing
